direction.raw_text: The door slams shut. Sam is locked inside. Frightened and desperate, he rushes for the door knob. His hand sinks through it. There is a strange sound, like ELECTRICAL STATIC, as it penetrates the metal and wood. Frightened, he yanks it back. Sam circles the space several times and then returns to the door. Clenching his teeth, he reaches out again. As his hand pushes up against it, we sense that he experiences a subtle resistance. The hairs on the back of his hand vibrate as his ghostly form presses into it. We sense Sam's fear as his entire arm DISAPPEARS FROM VIEW. The grating ELECTRICAL SOUND shudders up his spine. The sight of his amputated limb is unsettling but Sam does not pull back. Slowly he edges in and presses his face into the molecules of the wood.

direction.raw_text: as atoms and electrons spin past him at frightening speed. There is a sense of a universe in total chaos. Terrifying SOUNDS charge through his body.

He has a key in his hand and puts it in his pocket. Sam is stunned. The Mugger locks the door.

Molly's purple blouse hits the floor as she begins to remove her clothes. She turns on the radio. Sam doesn't know what to do. The Mugger seems excited by Molly's semi-nudity. He begins skirting the edges of the loft, moving toward the bedroom. Sam is crazed. Suddenly, out of nowhere, Frank appears at the Mugger's feet. Sam's eyes light up. He drops to his knees, crawls over to him, glares into his eyes, and screams.

direction.raw_text: The Mugger holds the cat's mouth shut. Seeing and hearing nothing, Molly steps back into the bedroom. The Mugger takes the cat and throws it across the floor. Holding his eye, he gets up and rushes for the exit. Sam runs after him, but the door closes before he can get through. He is left inside.

dialogue.raw_text: Frank, what's wrong?

direction.raw_text: stares at the closed door in a wild panic. He doesn't know what to do. Then, summoning all of his courage, he takes a blind, running slow motion leap and charges through it.

direction.raw_text: as he emerges from the door and lands on the other side. He seems excited to have survived and is very pleased with himself.

direction.raw_text: The Mugger steps out onto the sidewalk and hurries toward the subway. A patch of sleeve soaks up the blood from his eye. Sam starts after the man but instantly freezes. Hordes of people crowd the sidewalk. The crush of humanity is frightening. Two lovers, holding hands, are coming right at him. Before Sam is able to move, we hear the sound of their arms cutting through his ghostly form. Sam tries instinctively to dodge the crowds but people approach him from all angles. We hear a BABY CARRIAGE roll through Sam's feet and he nearly falls over trying to avoid it. His instincts will not let go. A barrage of images and SOUNDS assaults Sam. It is more than he can handle. Still, he refuses to give up. He stays close to the Mugger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mugger heads down a flight of steps into the IRT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mugger gets onto a crowded subway car. Sam stands near a corner of the train watching him. Suddenly, Sam notices that something odd is happening. One of the riders at the other end of the car is walking toward him. As he approaches the Mugger, he does not stop, but passes right through him. It takes Sam a moment to realize what is happening, but then it is too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With unholy fury the New Ghost charges into Sam. The attack is so unexpected and ferocious that Sam has no sense of how to defend himself. With unexpected power, the Ghost grabs hold of him and slams him into the subway door. Sam's head plows right through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Sam's head sticking outside of the car as the subway tunnel rushes past him. There is a panicked look on his face. The look intensifies as he turns and sees another train barreling down on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Sam's body inside the car still struggling with the Ghost as the other train shoots by the window. With a huge gasp, Sam shoots back into the car, and wrests himself free of the Ghost's hold. The Ghost flies after him, screeching. Sam surges through the door at the end of the train and finds himself on the bridge between the subway cars. The subway Ghost stares at him through the window with a wild, insane look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stay off! This is mine!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: FAVORING WINDOW With shocking impact, the Ghost's fist goes flying into the window. To Sam's terror and amazement, the window SHATTERS. The Ghost smiles. Passengers scream and Sam dives for cover. Sam stares at the broken glass with fascination and confusion. Suddenly, the train moves from the darkness of the tunnel into broad daylight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train stops at an elevated subway platform in Brooklyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam sees the Mugger exiting the train and frantically rushes after him.

direction.raw_text: . 321 PROSPECT PLACE - DAY The Mugger heads toward 321 Prospect Place. The streets are lined with old apartment buildings. Many windows are boarded up. TWO MEN, standing on the corner, are slamming a piece of heavy machinery onto the pavement. Sam hears GOSPEL MUSIC coming from a storefront church and notices a sign, "SISTER ODA MAE BROWN, MEDIUM, SPIRIT READER, ADVISOR." He looks up to a third story window and sees a similar sign with day-glo arrows pointing to the entrance on the street. He seems curious, but then realizes that the Mugger is nearly halfway down the block. He turns and rushes after him.

direction.raw_text: . 321 PROSPECT PLACE - DAY Sam and the mugger approach a tenement building at 321 Prospect Place.

direction.raw_text: Sam enters Willie's apartment. It is a squalid affair. Peeled paint chips litter the floor. The bed is unmade. Willie pulls open a drawer in a small nightstand and drops in the keys to Molly's loft. Sam sees his wallet. His driver's license, bank ID, and a photo of Molly are there, too. Furious, Sam lunges for Willie but then holds his punch, knowing it will have no effect. He turns instead to a window and, like the Ghost on the subway, smashes it with his fist. Nothing happens.
direction.name: direction

The Short Woman, however, walks right through it. Passersby laugh at the Old Lady talking to herself. Sam, unsettled, rushes away. As Sam rounds a corner, a sudden blast of MUSIC explodes out of nowhere. Sam jumps into the street, gasping. A phonograph needle SCRATCHES across a record and the MUSIC STOPS. Sam stares at the sign with curiosity. The MUSIC is compelling. After a moment's hesitation, he goes in the open door.

The whiteness of her garment makes it look as if she is glowing in the dark. Mrs. Santiago is wide-eyed. Sam smiles as Oda Mae steps into the room.

There is a hush in the room. Her body begins to tremble. Mrs. Santiago clutches her chair. Suddenly Oda Mae breaks out of her trance.

A twenty dollar bill changes hands. Sam watches, amazed at it all. Oda Mae sits down and goes back into her trance. Her eyeballs roll up into their sockets.

Then, like a phoenix rising from the ashes, she pulls herself up in her chair and assumes a normal pose. After several seconds to get her bearings, Oda Mae begins to speak. Only now she has an entirely new voice. It sounds deep and hoarse, like an old man's. For all its put on theatricality, it is strangely convincing.

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry. I don't believe you. Why are you doing this to me? I don't believe a word you're saying. Sam is dead. He's dead.

dialogue.raw_text: I'm holding her hand.

dialogue.raw_text: God, I love her. I love her so much.

dialogue.raw_text: (his eyes brightening) Ditto. Tell her "ditto".

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae heads for the door. Molly is confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae stops, pauses a moment, and walks back to the couch. Sam, relieved, paces back and forth. Oda Mae's eyes follow his voice as Molly watches her curiously.

direction.raw_text: Molly looks concerned. Sam leans into Oda Mae.

direction.raw_text: Molly grows pale as she listens. Her forehead tightens.

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae takes a card from her purse and grabs a pencil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae seems perplexed as she writes it down and gives it to Molly.

direction.raw_text: Molly stands up, afraid. Oda Mae stands up, too.

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae heads for the door as Molly watches in a daze.

direction.raw_text: She lets herself out. Sam just stands there as the door slams shut.

dialogue.raw_text: To tell the truth, I don't know how I'm doin' it. In fack, confidentially, nothin' like this never happened to me before. Now, all a sudden, I can't turn it off. (she sees a photo of Sam) Is this you? Is this him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; to Sam) Hazel eyes, huh? You sound like they'd be blue.

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand. Why did he come back? Why is he still here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cause he's stuck, that's why. He's between worlds. It happens sometimes, when their spirits get out too quick. He thinks he still has stuff t'do down here.

dialogue.raw_text: Come on Oda Mae, stop rambling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, oh, now he's got an attitude.

dialogue.raw_text: I do not have an attitude.

dialogue.raw_text: (to Molly) We're having a discussion. (back to Sam) Whataya mean, you're not angry? If you weren't angry you wouldn't be raisin' your voice like that.

dialogue.raw_text: Goddamn it, Oda Mae!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah ah, baby. That does it. I don't talk to anybody who takes the Lord's name in vain.

dialogue.raw_text: Relax, Oda Mae.

dialogue.raw_text: You relax. You're the dead one. You want my help, then you apologize. Nobody talks to me like that, understand?

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus Christ!

dialogue.raw_text: (to Molly) Excuse me, girl. Time for me to go.

dialogue.raw_text: I don't believe I'm watching this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn it. All right. I apologize.

dialogue.raw_text: He's sayin' you're in danger.

dialogue.raw_text: Danger?... What do you mean?

dialogue.raw_text: He says he knows the man who killed him, Willie Lopez. He's Puerto Rican.

dialogue.raw_text: Write it down.

dialogue.raw_text: Write it down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do it!

dialogue.raw_text: Now I'm a secretary.

dialogue.raw_text: Prospect Place. Apartment 4D.

dialogue.raw_text: ? Hey, that's my neighborhood.

dialogue.raw_text: Molly, he's got my wallet and my key. He was in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's got his wallet and key. He was in here.

dialogue.raw_text: In here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (directly to Molly) You have to go to the police. The Mugger wasn't acting alone. It was a setup, Moll. I was murdered.

dialogue.raw_text: He says he was set up, that he was murdered. He wants you to go to the police.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I'm sorry. I don't want nothin' to do with this.

dialogue.raw_text: Where you going?

dialogue.raw_text: Don't follow me! I've done all I'm gonna do. (opening the door) I'm finished. And I ain't comin' back. So don't you come botherin' me again cause it's over. I mean it. This is it. Have a nice life. Have a nice death. I'm goin'.

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN - THAT NIGHT Carl is pacing nervously. He seems very upset. After a moment he approaches Molly. Sam is behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl sits down beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam smiles. Carl stands up. His voice begins to rise.

direction.raw_text: Molly looks suddenly vulnerable.

direction.raw_text: Molly looks at Carl, annoyed. She doesn't believe him for a second.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Molly, there's no one on earth who'd like it to be true more than me, but you've got to be rational about this. I understand your desire to hold on to him, but this... this is absurd.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was real, Carl. She was real.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to her, Carl, goddamn it. She needs some support here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Molly, you're a grown woman. How can you believe some fortune teller from Brooklyn...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She was in touch with him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't believe it, Molly. Not for a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Carl. Open your mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carl, she knew things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you, the picture in Reno, the starfish,... damn it, Carl. (with great difficulty) She said Sam knew who killed him. That he was set up... murdered.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh boy. This is getting deranged. We're going off the deep end here.

dialogue.raw_text: This is sick. This is really sick. How can you swallow this crap? Who knows if this guy exists? Maybe she's just setting someone up.

dialogue.raw_text: Sam wants me to go to the police.

dialogue.raw_text: Sam wants you to go to the police? Molly! Jesus! Are you outta your mind? What are you gonna tell 'em? Some storefront psychic's been getting messages from the dead? Do you know how that sounds? You're talkin' ghosts here, for God's sake.

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I'm sorry. This stuff just really gets to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't believe me. You don't believe any of this, do you?

dialogue.raw_text: (half heartedly) I'm trying to, but... Look, if it'll make you sleep any better, I'll check it out, okay? Now why don't you go to bed. Try and get some sleep.

direction.raw_text: Carl, in his red Ford Mustang, is speeding up town. Sam is beside him in the front seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl steps into the lobby of Willie's building. Sam follows, wide-eyed. He seems both intrigued and astounded by what Carl is doing. When Carl stops to read the apartment number on Willie's mail box, Sam is thrilled.

direction.raw_text: Carl climbs the stairs two at a time and approaches Willie's door. He bangs on it, loudly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Way to go, Carl!

direction.raw_text: opens a crack as Willie peers out. Carl pushes it hard and it opens the rest of the way. Willie steps back.

direction.raw_text: Sam freezes as Willie addresses Carl by name. He can barely move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam is staggered. His body is shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl is fuming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie goes to the desk drawer and takes out Sam's key. Sam, unable to control himself, explodes in a fit of rage. Hauling back, he slugs Carl with all his might. His fist has no impact.

dialogue.raw_text: Carl, what're you doin' here?

dialogue.raw_text: (scared, in over his head) Who've you been talking to?

dialogue.raw_text: Talking to? What the hell do you mean? What's going on?

dialogue.raw_text: Some woman knows all about you. The murder, everything. Where's she getting it from, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell are you talking about? I haven't said a word.

dialogue.raw_text: She knows your name, goddamn it! She knows where you live!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A lot of women know where I live.

dialogue.raw_text: This isn't a joke, man. You find that bitch, whoever she is, and... get rid of her, you hear me? I've got four million dollars stuck in that fucking computer. If I don't get those codes, if that money's not transferred soon, I'm dead. If I lose Balistrari's money, we're both dead.

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him you only wash dirty money on the first of the month.

dialogue.raw_text: What is wrong with you? Is everything a joke? You were supposed to steal his wallet. You weren't supposed to kill him. Was that a joke?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (casually) I did you a favor. Freebee.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus! (sickened) These are drug dealers, man. (pause) Don't blow this for me, Willie. I've risked my job here. I could go to jail. A hundred thousand of that money goes to me. Now give me Sam's key. I'll get that address book myself.

dialogue.raw_text: You killed me, Carl. You had me killed. Look what you've done to me! Look what you've done!

direction.raw_text: Carl is on the street heading back to his car. Sam is beside him, yelling right into his face. He is screaming and cursing at the top of his lungs but Carl doesn't hear him.

direction.raw_text: From the distance, we see Sam smashing into Carl. It is like hitting the air. For all of his rage and bluster, there is nothing he can do.

dialogue.raw_text: You fucker! You mother fucker! I had a life, Goddamn you. I had a life!

direction.raw_text: Molly, neatly dressed, exits her building and hails a cab. She hops inside. Seconds later she hops out again, yelling.

dialogue.raw_text: You white fascist bigot. Who do you think you are? Bed Stuy's part of New York, you know. This is America.

direction.raw_text: Molly pays no attention. Children run up to her, stare, and run away.

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Snow, you lost or sumpin'?

direction.raw_text: When Molly turns down 131st Street, the crowds disperse and she is all alone. There is a sense of menace in the air. A group of young men sitting on a stoop watches as she walks by. One of them whistles. Molly keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly sees Willie's building. She walks into the dank lobby. It is dark and full of shadows. Leaning close, she examines the mail boxes. Willie's name is there. She backs away, afraid.

direction.raw_text: A dresser drawer opens and a box labeled "Sam's Things -- Valuable" is slowly pulled out. A hand reaches inside it and extracts Sam's address book. As THE CAMERA PULLS BACK, we see that it is Carl standing in Molly and Sam's livingroom. Carl opens the book and quickly jots down a series of code numbers he finds in the back. His eyes sparkle with excitement.

direction.raw_text: Molly is sitting in a room opposite DETECTIVE SERGEANT THOMAS BEIDERMAN, 48, and SERGEANT DOROTHY WALLACE, 29. Both officers are staring at her as she speaks. She seems very uncomfortable.

direction.raw_text: The officers don't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is dead silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leaves the room. Molly gives her a dirty look and turns to Beiderman.

direction.raw_text: Sgt. Beiderman gets up and looks over to Molly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heads out of the room. Molly sits back with an air of enormous relief and gratitude. Sergeant Wallace comes into the room again and picks up a folder. Molly waits nervously. After a moment Sergeant Beiderman returns with a police file in his hands. Molly looks up at him, and then smiles at Wallace as she sees it. She feels vindicated. He lays the thick folder on the desk and opens it up. She hurries over to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look, you've gotta believe me. I don't even believe this stuff, myself. But this is real. Do you think I'd come here if it wasn't real? You told me to come if I had any new information. Well, here I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Don't look at me like that. You guys use psychics all the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Damn it. I know how this sounds. I hear myself saying it and I want to cringe. But this woman knew things she couldn't have known, intimate details.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How intimate?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Things Sam only said to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smirking) Okay, let me get this straight. According to this psychic lady, there are ghosts and spirits all over the place, watching us all the time, huh?... (she stands up) I'm sorry. I've got important things to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm telling you. The killer's name is Willie Lopez. I've got his address. You've got to check it out.

direction.raw_text: S OF ODA MAE and reams of police paperwork. WIDEN as Molly stares at it all in sudden shock.

dialogue.raw_text: . BEIDERMAN There's no file for a Willie Lopez. He was probably some old boyfriend she was trying to get even with. This psychic woman's record goes back a long way. Fraud, numbers rackets, you name it. She's a real pro.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: between the records and Molly's stunned reaction. We see recent photos of Oda Mae and others going back to her youth. They are fascinating and revealing. We even see photos of her mother and grandmother. In addition, there are pages of arrest records and prison files.

direction.raw_text: Molly is overwhelmed by the evidence.

direction.raw_text: Molly turns away.

direction.raw_text: Molly's eyes widen.

dialogue.raw_text: . BEIDERMAN (continuing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . Shreveport, Louisiana. Forgery, selling false ID. Served one year. 1971. Baton Rouge. Arrested for fraud, numbers racketeering. Served ten months. 1974. Hattiesburg, Mississippi. Fraud, seven months. 1984. Albany, New York. Petty larceny. It goes on and on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEIDERMAN (continuing) This woman's a charlatan. You can't believe anything she said.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This isn't possible. There were words, private things. How could she have known all that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEIDERMAN They have ways.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ways? What ways?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEIDERMAN They've got a million cons. A lot of times they read the obits. All she had to do was see the word "banker". Hell, they even go through your garbage to find things they can use, letters, old papers. They don't need much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEIDERMAN (continuing) I bet you threw stuff out, huh? It could have been anything. What about that underwear she knew all about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEIDERMAN (continuing) Green underwear. I'll bet she zeroed right in on that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! She was real. She said things. She knew about a sweater I knitted, about songs we sang... She knew about this place we went, Montego Bay...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEIDERMAN I'm sorry. I know this is hard. People want so much to believe. They're grieving, vulnerable. They'd give anything for one last moment... money, insurance policies. Believe me, these people know what they're doing. Look, I know how you must feel. You know, you can press charges.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh God, I wanted it to be Sam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Molly is sitting in her bedroom. The glow of the late afternoon sunlight casts long shadows across the bed. She seems deeply depressed and alone. Gradually her gaze falls on a jar sitting on the nightstand. In it is the penny Sam found when they were first working on the loft. A label on the jar says, "For Luck!" In a moment of sudden rage, she picks it up and throws it against the wall. It SHATTERS on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The code from Sam's address book, jotted on a piece of paper, is sitting beside Carl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anxiously, Carl punches the code into a computer and, suddenly, Sam's old accounts appear on the screen. A look of relief wafts across Carl's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl is staring at the same accounts Sam was examining the afternoon before he was killed, the accounts with too much money in them. Carl picks up the phone and punches a number. Someone answers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (excitedly) God, let this be it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Oh God, yes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Tony, this is Carl. I'm all set. We're fine. Everything's fine. Just tell me what you want me to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on the other end begins to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl writes it all down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl hangs up. He seems deeply relieved.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We want you to transfer the money from the 12 separate accounts into a single account under the name "Rita Miller". Tomorrow, at five minutes before closing, 3:55 p. m., transfer the full account to First Island Bank of Nassau, registry number 486- 9580.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Call us when it's done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell Mr. Balistrari there won't be any problems.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He is standing in front of Carl, watching. Quickly, Carl begins punching commands into the computer. He is setting up the dummy account. Rita Miller, #926-31043.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly, in a short terrycloth robe, is sitting in a chair. A magazine is on her lap but she is staring vacantly into the loft. She seems lost in the vast space. Sam is pacing back and forth. There is a melancholy look in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the BELL rings. Molly jumps. Molly's finger is on the intercom. She seems unsettled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam freezes. Molly is surprised. She hesitates a moment and then pushes the buzzer to let him in. We hear Carl bounding up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a KNOCK. Molly opens the door. Carl seems buoyant, almost celebratory. He has a bag of fruit in his hand. He is still in a suit and tie.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why can't you hear me, Molly? I need you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Molly, it's Carl. Can I come up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't open it. He's a murderer, Moll!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi. Thanks. I know it's late. I'm sorry to disturb you. I felt bad about last night. This supernatural stuff just makes me so uncomfortable. I don't even read horoscopes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry. It's okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No it's not. You needed me to hear you and I didn't and that was wrong. I want you to know that I'm your friend, Moll.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were never our friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (holding out a paper bag) Hey, I brought you some Japanese apple pears. I know you like them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking the bag) Oh, that's so sweet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, can I come in for a minute? I won't stay long. I've had one of those days. Maybe a cup of coffee?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Moll. Don't do it. Don't let him in!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitating) Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGROOM - NIGHT Carl, in shirt sleeves and Molly in her robe, are sitting on the couch drinking coffee. We notice that Carl is wearing yellow suspenders. Sam is beside himself, watching them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly reaches out and pats his arm. There is an awkward pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam looks at her, amazed. Carl, on the other hand, stiffens. He laughs nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam is devastated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly holds back tears. Carl reaches out tenderly and strokes her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl glides his hand slowly, lovingly across her cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost imperceptibly, his hand moves down to the nape of her neck. As she moves, her robe opens slightly. Carl notices, glimpsing her nakedness beneath it. Sam notices, too. He freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly can barely contain her tears. Carl moves toward her moist cheeks and kisses them gently. Slowly, he guides his lips to her neck and kisses it, too. It is all hateful and sensual at the same time. Sam turns away. Molly feels Carl's tenderness, needs it. She does not notice his hand reaching for the cord on her robe and slowly pulling it toward him. With a little tug the cord unravels and the robe falls open. Molly is confused, aroused, not sure what to do. She starts to pull it closed. He holds her hand. For a moment they do nothing. Then his fingers reach for her thigh. Her body quivers. Carl feels her openness and pulls closer, his hand rising gently up her naked body. Molly's eyes close. She says nothing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you alright? You look nervous, upset.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (glancing at her thighs) What can I tell you. It's been tough. Hell, you know. It still hurts so much. (he poses sadly) Then on top of it all... it's the responsibilities. They've given me my own accounts, but I've had no time to adjust. My mind has been reeling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Where were you this morning? I thought you were coming to the bank to sign those papers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't have time. (beat) I went to the police, Carl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're kidding. You really did it? I don't believe... What did you tell them? What did they say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were right, you know. I felt like such a fool. They brought out a file on this psychic woman ten inches thick. It was awful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (relieved) A ripoff artist, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked) Molly, no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The sad part is that I believed her. I believed her, Carl. (pause) It was all a sham.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (relaxing) Sometimes we need to believe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?... I was a fool. I don't believe anything anymore. Why would people do such things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (milking it) It's hard to face reality, Moll, the hard cold facts of it. What you have to remember is the love you felt. That's what's real. You have to remember how good Sam was. How much he loved you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You were everything to him, Molly. You were his life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (finally crying) I feel so alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not alone. You're young. You've got so much talent. You're fantastically gorgeous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (appreciating his words) Oh God, I don't know what's real anymore. I don't know what to think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just think about Sam. Think about what he meant to you, the years you had together, how wonderful they were.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Let your feelings out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Life turns on a dime, Moll. People think they have forever, that they'll always have tomorrow. But it's not true. Sam taught us that. We have to live for now, for today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sam charges wildly at the couch and begins flailing uncontrollably at the two of them. Unexpectedly his foot kicks out and hits a framed photograph of him and Molly that's sitting on an end table. The picture CRASHES to the floor, the glass SHATTERING. Molly jumps up, the mood suddenly broken. She sees the photo and recoils. Carl reaches for her. She backs away. Sam is stunned by what has happened. He jumps up and tries kicking over another picture but nothing moves. His foot goes right through it. Molly looks at Carl, drying her tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches out and takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly hesitates a moment and then nods her head "yes". Carl smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't. I'm sorry. I can't. It's too soon... You've been great Carl, but... I need you to leave. Please. I need you to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. It's okay. I understand. I really do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Look, what if we have dinner tomorrow night? Just talk. Can I interest you in that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sam rushes madly down a flight of stairs into a subway station. A train is just leaving. He jumps on board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam begins quickly casing the aisles, looking for something. It is not there. Another train can be seen speeding past the window. Sam takes a running leap and jumps onto it, passing through the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: disappointed. Suddenly, an express train passes alongside his local. Sam sticks his face inside it. Suddenly, he smiles and rushes onto it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam does not have to stand there long. Within seconds, the terrifying Ghost he had seen before comes charging at him. We notice him more clearly now. He is wearing a dark blue pea coat. There is a grizzled look about him. He has stained teeth and seems perpetually unshaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This time Sam does not back away. He holds his ground. The Ghost lets fire every trick in his arsenal. Posters come flying off the walls. A bag of groceries topples from a woman's arms, an old man's cane flies across the aisle, a boy's Mets cap flips off his head. People on the train move quickly to other cars. Unable to frighten him, the Ghost kicks Sam in the stomach. Sam recoils, feeling it, but gets back up again. He is angry now. He begins raging at the other Ghost. The Ghost is shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Ghost, exhausted, looks up at him and smiles with appreciation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam nods in agreement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get off my train!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Teach me how you do that! I want to learn! I'm not leaving til you teach me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You stubborn asshole.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sitting in the corner of a deserted subway station. Sam is trying desperately to push a bottle cap with his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Ghost demonstrates, kicking a garbage pail onto its side. Sam can't quite tell how he did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With surprising energy, the Ghost flicks a bottle cap and sends it shooting across the subway platform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kicks a Coke can toward Sam. Sam tries to kick it back and misses. The Ghost laughs. Sam gets angry. He tries again and falls on his head. The Ghost laughs louder. Now Sam is really angry. We see him forcing the anger down into his stomach. He holds still for a moment and then kicks at the can with all his might. To his shock and amazement, it sails right through the Ghost's head. The Ghost smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) What are you doing? What are you doing? You can't push it with your finger. You're dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't get it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's your mind, you idiot. It's all in the mind. The problem is you think you're still real, that you're standin' on the floor, that you're wearin' those clothes. Bullshit! You don't even have a body anymore. It's all up here. You wanna move things, you gotta use your mind. You gotta focus! You hear what I'm saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you focus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know how you focus! You just focus!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) It's all in the anger. You gotta direct it. You gotta channel it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm angry all the time. It doesn't do a thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cause you're angry all over. You gotta be angry here, in the pit of your stomach. Bring it down here. Let it explode. (he makes an explosive gesture) It's like a reactor, you know. Pow!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Way to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: practicing. He smashes at an abandoned tennis shoe with his fist. Nothing happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam's stomach bulges. He tries again. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Undaunted, Sam tries once more. This time the tennis shoe moves. The Ghost nods his head approvingly. Sam is thrilled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Venom spews from the Ghost's mouth. Suddenly he rams a cigarette machine full force with his head. The glass SHATTERS and packs of cigarettes scatter everywhere. He throws himself on top of them with terrible longing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rolls and wallows in terrible frustration, tossing the cigarettes in all directions. Suddenly he looks up and sees Sam. He is unable to control his fury.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: From your gut. What do I keep tellin' you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Give it time! What else have you got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long have you been here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Since they pushed me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Someone pushed you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, someone pushed me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? You don't believe me? You think I fell? You think I jumped? Well, fuck you! (an unexpected rage starts to build) It wasn't my time! I wasn't supposed to go! I'm not supposed to be here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I'd give everything for a drag. Just one drag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Who the hell are you? Why are you hounding me like this? Leave me alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is shooting through the station. The Ghost throws himself into it and in an instant he is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBWAY STATION - NIGHT Sam, all alone, walks through the station. Suddenly, he reaches out and pushes a garbage can lid. It swings back and forth. He is delighted. A beer can is sitting on a bench. He pushes it off, watching it roll across the platform with childlike glee. Looking up, Sam sees an advertisement for Market Security Bank and Trust. He stares at it with great interest. "Special Banking for Special People. We make it easy for you." Something registers in Sam's eyes. He yells and jumps straight up, hitting a subway sign with his finger. With great excitement, he runs for the stairs and rushes from the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SEANCE ROOM - NIGHT ORTISHA JONES, a black woman with brassy red hair, is sitting at Oda Mae's seance table surrounded by several of her relatives. Clara and Louise stand behind Oda Mae helping with the ritual. Oda Mae goes into her trance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A GROUP OF GHOSTS is milling behind Oda Mae. Sam comes barging into the room and looks at them in amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae, startled, jumps up in her chair. Everyone else jumps, too. Clara and Louise look worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ortisha and her relatives look up, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the GHOSTS standing in the background butts in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ortisha looks at Oda Mae. She has no idea what's going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ortisha is totally confused. Oda Mae turns back to her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sam?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is all this? What's goin' on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What'd you do, tell every spook in town about me? I got spooks from out of town here. There's stuff goin' on you wouldn't believe. I can't hardly believe it myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oda Mae. You're doing it. This is for real. How do you like that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on. Look at this. You're doing great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you hurry this up? My husband's in the waiting room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need your help, Oda Mae. There's something we need to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget it. I'm not doin' anything. You're holdin' on to a life that don't want you no more. Give it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give it up? I'm already dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dead, yeah, but you ain't finished dyin'. Give up the ghost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And how am I supposed to do that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're asking me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you speaking to me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does it look like I'm speakin' to you? (continuing; to Sam) So, are you gonna leave or not? I've got work to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) What's a matter? You're supposed to be concentrating. How do you expect me to do this if you're not concentrating? Okay then. You ready? Let's do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae and everyone in the room gets very quiet. One of the ghosts draws close. Oda Mae's eyes roll up into her head. Then, suddenly, an extraordinary thing occurs. We see the spirit pull back and dive right into Oda Mae. Oda Mae gulps. Her nostrils flare. Her eyes bulge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae's body goes into bizarre convulsions as the Ghost tries to move inside her. She looks strangely stuffed and enormously uncomfortable. Sam and the others watch in astonishment as she tries to speak, but nothing comes out. Then suddenly the GHOST speaks through Oda Mae.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ortisha and her relatives jump up in amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Orlando suddenly zeros in on Ortisha. His eyes widen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ortisha smiles excitedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Oda Mae's body begins to shake wildly and her voice booms out, screaming with all her might.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With frightening speed, she sends the spirit catapulting out of her body. Clara and Louise jump up. Oda Mae is shaking.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Lord! Stop! Whatcha doin' to me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming) Ortisha?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excitedly) Orlando! Is that you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disoriented) Ortisha, where are you? I can't see too good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here! She's here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In front of you! I'm right here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mother of God, what've you done to your hair!?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Orlando, do you like it? It's Autumn Sunrise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get out of here, you little shit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Lord oh Lord, don't you ever do that to me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confused) Orlando!?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ORLANDO He is lying on the floor, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ortisha looks around the room, befuddled. Clara and Louise aren't sure what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ortisha and her relatives scurry out fast. The ghosts, too, begin passing through the wall. Oda Mae lays her head on the table. Suddenly her whole body begins heaving. She is starting to cry. Sam is surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam hesitates a moment and then respectfully follows the others through the wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What happened to me? I can barely move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should know better than to try that. It's not worth it. It'll wipe you out for days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was incredible, Oda Mae.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never again. Never.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Orlando?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He spoke through you. It was amazing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No more, uh uh, no more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened to Orlando? Where'd he leave the insurance policy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're great, Oda Mae! You're a real medium. It's what you were born for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want everybody out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Orlando?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oda Mae, what's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Out! I said out! That means you, too!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SEANCE ROOM - NIGHT Clara knocks on the seance room door and peeks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie pushes his way into the room. Clara isn't sure what to do. Oda Mae looks up. She does not know him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae stares at him curiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sits down across from Oda Mae and shows no signs of leaving. Oda Mae observes him quietly for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae glares at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oda Mae, there's a man here who says he has to see you right away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't seein' nobody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you the one that can talk to the dead?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I beg your pardon! I'm not seeing customers right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said I need to know if you're the one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm the one. But not now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is important. I have a friend. He died recently. Some say he was mugged. I think he was murdered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I'm told you can contact people like that. Is that true?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's been known to happen. But it's not gonna happen now, so come back later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't wait til later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's your friend's name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good question. Why don't you tell me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You're the psychic, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This ain't no guessin' game.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then what is it, lady?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lookit, I don't know what your trouble is... (getting nervous) Who are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're the mindreader. I hear you've been tellin' people about me for days. What's my name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: confused and uncomfortable. Sam comes wandering back into the room. His eyes bulge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie sits straight up in his chair, amazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a sudden thrust, Oda Mae sends her foot shooting into Willie's balls. As he recoils she knocks the table into his lap and rushes for the closet. We see her barricade herself in the hidden chamber. Willie, shaking, scrambles to his feet and, before Sam can stop him, BLASTS his gun at the closet door. It is riddled with bullets. Sam screams out. Willie runs to the side door and escapes to the street. Clara and Louise come rushing in. Sam charges into the closet and sees that Oda Mae is safe behind the false door. Then he hurries to the street.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Willie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willie!?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How'd you know that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I'm psychic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STREET - NIGHT Sam rushes to the sidewalk and looks in all directions. Willie is nowhere to be seen. He hurries back to Oda Mae.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SEANCE ROOM - NIGHT The room is a disaster area, full of hysterical women. Oda Mae is being dragged from the closet, unhurt but in a state of shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her sisters start talking but she shoos them away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He tried to kill me! Why? Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Talk to me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oda Mae, we're in trouble...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're in trouble? Who's we? You're already dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can stop them. But I can't do it alone. You've gotta help me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help you? It's me they're tryin' to kill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right. And they'll be back. I'm your only chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you go find a haunted house and rattle some chains.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need you Oda Mae. I need you to get some fake ID's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fake ID's? What for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help me now, they'll never bother you again. I promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stopping, thinking) Help you? Whataya talking about exactly? What else do I have to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae, dressed to the hilt, is walking with Sam toward the main branch of Market Security Bank & Trust. She seems nervous and upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they reach the entrance of the bank, they pass a pair of NUNS collecting money to build a shelter for the homeless. One of them holds out a collection box. Oda Mae passes her by, carefully avoiding eye contact.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is crazy. This ain't gonna work. I don't know nothin' 'bout bankin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll teach you. You'll learn fast.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: & TRUST - DAY Oda Mae enters Sam's bank. She seems completely out of place. Sam, walking beside her, directs her every move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae approaches the New Accounts desk. She seems very uptight. A woman OFFICER behind the desk looks up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Officer checks out the name and account number on her computer screen. It all seems to jive. She pulls out a card from her desk and hands it to Oda Mae. Oda Mae stares at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae nods and starts to sign "Oda Mae". Sam stops her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam hits his forehead with his hand. The Officer gives her another card. Oda Mae signs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae, delighted, walks away smiling and gives the officer a wave. She is loving this.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: See where it says "New Accounts"? That's where you're going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (paranoid) I'm not givin' 'em any money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just do what I say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I help you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell her you're here to fill out a signature card for a new account.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm here to fill out a signature card for a new account.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And do you know your account number?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rita Miller.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell her Rita Miller.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rita Miller.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyeing her oddly) Didn't they have you sign a card when you opened the account?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell her Carl Bruner opened it for you by phone and asked you to come in today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carl Bruner opened it for me. He asked me to come in today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just sign you name at the bottom on the first blank line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) No, no, no. Rita Miller.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the officer) Can I have another one please? I signed the wrong name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell her to see that it goes right up to the third floor file since you have a transaction to make.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need you to put that in the third floor file cause I got a transfusion to make.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what I mean. (innocently) Umm, can I keep the pen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised, not sure what to say) ...uh, sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The clock on Carl's wall says 3:40. He seems anxious. The phone RINGS. Carl jumps. He pushes down the speaker button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up. His hand is shaking.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello. Carl Bruner speaking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Balsitrari
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Balistrari? Carl, it's me, John. I've got the info on the Bradley portfolio.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah, yeah. That's great. I'll pick it up later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: & TRUST - DAY Sam and Oda Mae approach a fancy part of the bank housing administrative personnel. They approach a GUARD who is standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She waves him on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the Guard leaning over Mr. Furgeson's desk. FURGESON looks up and sees Oda Mae. He shrugs his shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Guard comes back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam pokes her. She yelps, surprised, and glances around. The Guard gives her an odd look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She forces a smile. He smiles back and then goes over to Mr. Furgeson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Guard whispers in Furgeson's ear. Furgeson appears totally flummoxed. He looks up at Oda Mae, embarrassed, and waves. The Guard motions her to come back. She walks proudly over to his desk. He sticks out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up into the air. Furgeson eyes her strangely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He punches Rita Miller's number into the computer. A figure appears on the screen. He stares at it for a few seconds and then punches it in again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae reaches into her purse and pulls out a DRIVER'S LICENSE and a SOCIAL SECURITY CARD. Furgeson gets up and walks away from his desk. He seems unsteady on his feet. An OFFICER at the next desk is using a Brillo pad to clean a stain on her desk. Oda Mae smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Officer nods appreciatively.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tell the guard you're here to see Lyle Furgeson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lyle Furgeson, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have an appointment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I'm here for the fun of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't say that! Tell him Rita Miller's here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him Rita Miller's here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just one moment, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't embellish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning around) Excuse me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) Now listen, this guy Furgeson's a real jerk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why are you whispering?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he doesn't know) Just be quiet and listen. I've known him five years and he still thinks my name's Paul.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) He's a social moron. You don't have to worry about anything. Tell the guard Furgeson knows you. You spent time with him and his wife Shirley at the Brewster's Christmas party last year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is this regarding?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? He doesn't remember me? We were together at the Brewster's Christmas party. With his wife Shirley. They had that lovely tree... all those presents. Why, I'll never forget all those beautiful...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Oops. Gas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This'll be easy. Furgeson was so drunk at that party, he could have had a conversation with Tina Turner and he wouldn't remember.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, hello. Of course, of course. It's been so long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ask how Bobby and Snooky are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How are Bobby and Snooky doin'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (perplexed) Why, they're just fine, thank you. Nice of you to ask. And how is your... family?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Couldn't be better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, isn't that wonderful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him you've been wondering how they did on the Gibraltar securities.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So tell me, Fergie, how did you do on the Gibraltar securities?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) The Gibraltar securities! Well, it looks like we topped out, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "We sure did!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We sure did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impressed) That was a wonderful tip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Good old Randy".
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good old Randy. Got a real head on his shoulders.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Her" shoulders.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Her" shoulders.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure does. Well... well. So what brings you here today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're closing an account.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm closing an account.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... wonderful. Do you have your account number?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Make that 31-0-43... Numbers. I'm dyslexic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (trying to be calm) Well, Rita, you'll be withdrawing four million dollars from us today, is that correct?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Four million dollars?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say "yes"!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gasping) Yes! Four million. That's right. That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And how will you want that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tens and twenties?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pardon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A cashier's check! Tell him a cashier's check.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A cashier's check.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine. Of course, you realize we're required to get some identification from everyone. It's just procedural. You understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, if you put that Brillo pad in the freezer, it'll last twice as long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Furgeson lays Oda Mae's ID next to her signature card. The signatures match up. He nods his head in approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl looks up at the clock. It is 3:50. He pushes down a button on the phone. A SECRETARY answers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Yes, Mr. Bruner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get me the First Island Bank of Nassau. It's on the rolodex.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: & TRUST - DAY Mr. Furgeson returns with Rita Miller's signature card and a cashier's check for $4,000,000. Oda Mae's hand shakes as she examines it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam looks up and gulps. Molly has just entered the bank and is heading toward them. He jumps up nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae signs a form closing the account. Of course the signatures match. Mr. Furgeson examines them both and smiles. He shakes Oda Mae's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam rushes over to Molly. He is not sure what to do. He notices a stack of deposit forms on the counter she is about to pass. He hurries to it and flicks the entire stack, a hundred sheets, flying up into the air. Molly, confused, thinks she is responsible and stoops to pick them up. Sam, delighted, flicks another stack. Oda Mae is talking a blue streak when Sam returns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae smiles and leaves. There is a new lilt in her walk. Suddenly Sam looks and sees Molly about to stand up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At that second, Oda Mae spots a quarter lying on the ground. She stoops down and picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly sees her, does a double take, and starts to go after her. Unfortunately, Oda Mae steps onto an elevator before Molly can catch up. The doors close. Molly stops for a moment and then looks back across to the executive area. She sees Lionel Furgeson and hurries over to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is surprised to see her and grows instantly solicitous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly stares at Furgeson. She is not sure what to think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks away, confused.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'll just need your signature right here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sign Rita Miller.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I'll be back in a minute. You're on your own. Don't say anything foolish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now you be careful with this. It's like carrying cash, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (positively glowing) I sure do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Then my mother took all the money from the oil wells and put it in gasoline pumps. Every gas station has 'em you know, sometimes six or more. It adds up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oda Mae, come on. We gotta get out of here. Say goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (abruptly getting up) Well, I've got to leave. It's been a pleasure doin' business with you. Say "hi" to Shirley and Snooky for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Rita. I'll be glad to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry up, Oda Mae.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excitedly) What a day!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lionel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Molly. How are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lionel, a woman who just left, a black lady, about my height, did you see her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, yes. I just took care of her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did she want? Did it have anything to do with me? Did she ask about Sam?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (not understanding) Sam? No. Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was her name Oda Mae Brown?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Rita Miller. She just closed an account.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Is there a problem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitating, not sure what to say) No. I guess not. Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carl, in front of his computer, is going crazy. He keeps punching buttons on the keyboard but the same response appears over and over on the screen. "RITA MILLER, #926-31043. ACCOUNT CLOSED. BALANCE $00.00." Panicked, Carl jumps up. He moves quickly, erratically around the office and then back to the computer. He punches the keys over and over. The same answer appears on the screen. The account is closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl runs through the office. He seems crazed. People look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl freezes. He doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Carl, is something wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is someone playing with the computers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is this a joke? One of my accounts is closed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which account? What's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You want me to call someone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (changing his demeanor) No, no. Never mind. It's okay. It's all right. I can do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: & TRUST - DAY Sam and Oda Mae are walking down the street in front of the bank. Oda Mae is talking to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stops. There is a nervous look on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae, worried, removes the check but holds onto it tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae looks at the nuns collecting money for the homeless. She recoils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae growls at him. With great difficulty, she approaches the nuns. The nuns look at her with curiosity and compassion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With great hesitation, Oda Mae begins to write. We sense that every word is a torment for her. The nuns politely avert their eyes from the check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oda Mae gives her a dirty look and hands the check over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns on her high heels and wobbles away. Sam calls after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She growls again. In the background we see the nuns secretly peeking at the check. One of them, wide-eyed, faints dead away. The other nun stoops down and fans her face in an attempt to revive her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oda Mae. Take the check out of your purse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take it out? Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Now endorse it. Sign Rita Miller.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in shock) Endorse it? Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do what I say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's blood money, Oda. I was killed for that money. Endorse it now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you going to do with it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're giving it away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Away? What do you mean? To who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look to your left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you outta your mind?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do what I tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! (clutching the check) I can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, you can. If you don't do it, they'll track you down. Your only protection is to get rid of it, now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sweet Jesus, you're killing me, Sam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm saving you, Oda Mae. You'll go to heaven for this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Write "St. Joseph's Shelter".
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bless you, child.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm proud of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you talk to me. I don't want you comin' round no more. I mean it. Understand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, we're friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Friends? Friends?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think you're wonderful, Oda Mae.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is after hours. Almost everyone on the floor has gone. Carl, hunched over his computer, is typing furious commands on the keyboard. He looks haggard and worn. Sequence after sequence of coded numbers flash past on the monitor screen. Sam, sitting in a desk chair, watches, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a moment of childish delight, he pushes his feet against the wall and the chair shoots across the room. Carl looks up and sees an empty chair moving. He stares at it in confusion, and then goes back to the screen. He seems desperate. Nothing is working. Panicked and frightened, Carl flicks off the machine and storms furiously around the room. Sam approaches the computer, hesitates a moment, and then pushes the power switch. The computer CLICKS back on. Carl spins around. He stares at the computer curiously for a moment and then turns it back off. Sam, enjoying this, reaches for the switch and FLICKS it back on again. Carl stares at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl watches as the keys seem to depress themselves and letters begin appearing on the screen. He sits down, mesmerized by what is happening. Then his face grows tense. The word "M-U-R-D-E-R-E-R" is emerging before him. Carl flies out of his chair, frantically running around to see who else is on the floor. He yells out like a madman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no one there. He hears the computer beginning to type again and hurries back to look at the screen. One word appears. "S-A-M". Carl gasps and smashes the computer with his fist. It crashes to the floor. Electrical sparks go flying as Carl gasps for breath. Sam cannot hold himself back any longer. With a horrifying scream, he charges at Carl, jamming his fist hard into his ribs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl grabs his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hits Carl again. Carl gasps in inexplicable pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam keeps hitting deeper into Carl's mid-section. Carl doubles over as though he's going to throw up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam is flushed with excitement. Carl kneels beside his desk. He cannot understand what is happening to him. His face goes stark white as the attack continues. Then, unexpectedly, the assault stops. Sam, exhausted, stares hatefully at his old friend cowering on the floor. Slowly and dizzily, Carl gets up. He looks fearfully around the office and then, holding his stomach, hurries from the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Search, you bastard! You'll never find it. It's gone. (he smiles) They'll kill you for this, Carl. You and Willie. They'll wipe you off the face of the earth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Who's doing that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You bastard! You goddamn bastard!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's dinner time, Carl. Don't you have a date with Molly, you creepy son-of-a bitch?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus! Oh God!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Molly, all dressed to go out, is sitting in Sam's easy chair, asleep. Suddenly Carl arrives knocking at her door. He does not look well. Sam is with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly eyes Carl with concern as he enters the loft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam tenses. He holds up his hand as if wanting her to stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl turns white. His eyes bulge. He feels sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Concerned, she hurries from the room. Sam digs his hands into Carl's back. Carl jerks forward in intense pain and begins flailing at the air.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Carl? Where were you? I thought we were having...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry. Things just got so crazy. I completely forgot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Old Carl had a little trouble at the office.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgot? I was worried. Is everything okay? Are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm okay. I'm alright. Look, can I talk to you for minute? Can I come in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I need to ask you a question.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He needs to borrow four million dollars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Molly, I know what the police said, but when you thought Sam was here, when you thought he spoke to you, what did you feel? What did he say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why? What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very tense) Molly, that psychic woman, I want to know what she told you. I want to know what she said.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carl, stop this. It was all a hoax. I told you. It wasn't real. She's a charlatan. (she hesitates and stares at Carl) Does this have anything to do with her being at the bank today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh shit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gulping) At the bank?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was sure I saw her. Furgeson says she was taking out money. It turns out her name isn't even Oda Mae Brown. It's Rita Miller or something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) What's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stomach. My stomach. Do you have anything? Pepto Bismol.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (worried) Sure. Just a second. What's going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing to me. Get away! Get away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sam does not go away. Freaked, Carl runs into the kitchen and rushes to the stove. Quickly he turns on the gas. He looks crazed. Turning to the air, he begins whispering loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam jabs at the knob on the stove and begins to turn it off. Carl sees it move. Shocked and frightened, he grabs it and pulls it off, leaving only the tiny stem in place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, frightened, tries with all his might but he cannot twist it. Carl pulls out a cigarette lighter and gloats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam rushes at Carl about to jam his full fist into his chest, but then he stops, afraid. He pulls back, shaken. Carl stands there waiting for a blow that doesn't come. He begins to gloat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam freezes. Molly enters the kitchen. She grabs her nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl acts as if that's the reason he came into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He fiddles with the dials and turns it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She opens a window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly is speechless.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You touch me again and I'll set her on fire. I mean it. I'll kill her. I'll blow up the whole building if I have to. Stay away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Go on, try it again. Let me see you turn it off now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Try and hurt me. I'll kill her if you hurt me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's a matter? You believe me, huh? You better believe me! I want my money. I need that money and I want it tonight -- at 11:00. If that psychic lady doesn't bring it here, Molly's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God. Is that the gas?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must have left the stove on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Just glad I smelled it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confused) Me, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Molly, I'm sorry. I've got to go. Look, there's something going on. I can't talk now. Some trouble at the bank.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trouble? What kind of trouble? Is it that woman, the psychic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't have time to talk now. What if I come back? Around 11:00?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carl, what's going on? Let me help you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't. I'm sorry to do this, but it's important. I'll be back.
